wiki.content: In These Arms was written by Jon Bon Jovi, David Bryan and Richie Sambora. It was released in 1993 as the third single from Bon Jovi's 1992 album Keep the Faith. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: In These Arms was written by Jon Bon Jovi, David Bryan and Richie Sambora. It was released in 1993 as the third single from Bon Jovi's 1992 album Keep the Faith.

track.name: In These Arms
comments: Such a great intro.
Love the emotional feeling this song brings.
Don't stop believin' in these arms!!

I love Alec's bass line in this song. It is cool. I totally agree with MissWeird about those 10 seconds from 4:42 to 4:52, especially when they do it live on the Lost Highway Live From Tokyo Dome DVD.
Like a poet needs the pain,i need you!

i am fortunate enough to "feel" the conveyance of emotion Jon intended when he wrote the track. WOW - to have found another @ this stage of the game & even more incredible - it's mutual. . .I LOVE U BABE! stay strong!

brillant, brillant song.

just awesome!
Nowadays I can't stop to hear this songO.o .Incredible track..
i'd tell you that i'd never leave you
Jon, If you were in these armsssssssssssssssss.... :))) <3

i,ve seen Bon Jovi 4 times.way back in 82 they opened for the Scorpions.it was they,re first album.the only hit was Runaway.but nonetheless they were good.the next album,got them started on the way to being a superband,still playing 30 yrs later,and sounding,just as good as the 80,s...
4:42-4:52 ....BEST 10 SECONDS, EVER.
one of their best songs ever ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh jbj is a genius
totally brilliant
Maybe my favourite Bon Jovi song.
Like the poet needs the plain - Bloody brillant
Bon Jovi and the day begins :-)
megageil
Absolutely love this song since my childhood times!
Quality tune
